text: You’ve added an audio source to your scene of a car alarm going off, and you set the min and max distance appropriately. However, when you test your scene you can hear the car alarm at a high volume even though you’re well out of range. What is most likely to have occurred? Select one answer.
skills: Produce customized results by correctly configuring audio in a scene

options.text: The volume rolloff was set to linear.
The priority of the audio source has been set to 1.
The Bypass Effects property has been set to True on the audio source.
The spatial blend hasn’t been set to 3D.

feedbackCorrect: Even with the min and max distance on an audio source set, an audio clip will still play at a consistent volume throughout the scene unless its spatial blend is set to 3D.
feedbackIncorrect: Even with the min and max distance on an audio source set, an audio clip will still play at a consistent volume throughout the scene unless its spatial blend is set to 3D.
